posts.post_description:
(Replace this first paragraph with a brief description of your new category. This guidance will appear in the category selection area, so try to keep it below 200 characters.)
Use the following paragraphs for a longer description, or to establish category guidelines or rules:
Why should people use this category? What is it for?
How exactly is this different than the other categories we already have?
What should topics in this category generally contain?
Do we need this category? Can we merge with another category, or subcategory?

Uh… Why is this at the top of the feed, and is this supposed to be available for public comment?
Just saying. Delete my comment as you see fit.

This seems to be an “About page” without any text. I wonder if the commentator community might use this thread to discuss an issue of our choice. @dara had a similar idea some time ago.
Medicare for all and strategies to implement it?
Third party organization or organizing within the Democratic party?
Thoughts?
Note: to reach this thread click on “News & Views” in the upper right.

I’m game, but I could not find the link to this page by searching the home page and searching for
“Views”. There is no clickable text called News & Views that I see. But even if there was, that isn’t going to funnel many people here (how you and @bluevote found it still escapes me). So it seems like people can only find this thread with an invite? Being limited to 5, I will add on this post:
@Maineac, @minecritter, @1Nall, and though I have no idea of he is coming back, it is after Jan 1 now, so I hope @SkepticTank is willing to post though I would understand if he is bitter.
Of the 2 possibilities you mention, I am more interested in M4A (should I stay with M4A or is MfA or MFA better? writing it out all the time seems tedious). But I don’t have any problem with anyone who wants to discuss anything on this thread.
On M4A, I am as you know still interested in #forcethevote. I listen to Jimmy Dore a lot and he is definitely not for everyone, but as they say, one should be able to judge an idea on its merits and not on whether one likes the person who came up with it. (My exception on this is if the idea is very complicated and I’m not going to be able to understand it in which case I will use a little “appeal to authority” if I like that authority and trust them - that doesn’t apply here). I haven’t heard anyone use the argument that Jimmy is bad, thus the idea is bad, but it is supposedly out there.
I have signed on at ~https://forcethevote.org/ and only about 40k people have signed thus far. I wish it was a lot more and I wish more people from PNHP would sign on (in this post, there is a reference to Dr. Flowers advocating for it: ~https://commons.commondreams.org/t/in-secret-ballot-vote-house-democrats-overwhelmingly-deny-aoc-a-powerful-committee-seat/85222/109). I’ve heard Dr. Adam Gaffney some more now and I don’t think he’s as opposed to the idea as I first gathered. It’s kind of hard to keep up with Katie Halper’s content - conversations go on for many hours and I haven’t heard all of what Gaffney has said on these YouTube shows and I haven’t found a written piece by him on the topic. But I find AOC’s comment that the leaders of the movement haven’t asked for this annoying. Because 1) One leader clearly has, 2) a non-trivial number of people in the movement clearly feel differently and at least she can engage us (she could have showed up at the recent townhall which I wasn’t able to see yet, but I know she wasn’t there).
As far as the idea goes - as you know these are some of the previous points I’ve made which I repeat for this thread:
If there is another M4A related thing we want besides a floor vote, we should be demanding that too. I happen to think the floor vote is a significant thing and I’m not enthusiastic about state run single payer systems (though I would of course support trying if it happens in California which hasn’t been in the cards for us this far - I don’t think our current governor would do it either, but maybe his hand can be forced).
This ‘demand’ should really be phrased to Pelosi as “why do you care if you give us this?” There is no one (besides Dore) that I know of that thinks House, Senate, and Biden would go along with the plan we have now at this time (or in Biden’s case - ever). Pelosi can make her case of why she thinks it is a stupid idea and she can get her “opposing the left” cred which I assume she wants (it’s working for her thus far).
A floor vote (and whatever discussion that goes along - if there were none and just a 5 min. vote, I don’t think I would care about this idea - but as I understand it, there will be discussion along with hopefully laying out basic funding scheme options which those that read Michael Pollin might now, but many don’t) will give us the following things:
a) It lays out clearly who is with us and who is against us (I hated GWB, but I do feel polarization on this issue is not a bad thing).
b) It will get the idea into more people’s heads (well, we don’t control the media and I’m sure they’ll do their best to spin it against us, but I still think more exposure is helpful).
c) On this point - I am not the most confident, but I think it will allow us to dig into financing details more and help frame future bills.
In general, I find the argument that it won’t pass besides the point. The idea is to be as ready as we can whenever it can pass (I assume 4 years is the soonest possible time frame, but I absolutely don’t want to wait 25 years - assuming I live that long).
Thanks for thinking of me!
Anybody who posts - please add 5 more usernames you think might be interested.

I caught a post by @Unmentionables that links to the townhall that I wasn’t able to watch live (thanks):
it is at:
~https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FVyBHFn7hjw (content starts at 16 min 29 sec )

topic_details.topic_title: Welcome to The Commons @ Common Dreams

posts.post_description:
This News & Views category is automatically generated as new articles are published on the front page 50 of the Common Dreams website.
This forum contains the readers comments that appear at the bottom of each article on our website.
We recommend heading over to Common Dreams and taking a look at our front page, but if you prefer this method of reading headlines, there is a permalink to each article at the top of each comment thread that will take you back to the original article. Please take the time to read each article before commenting to ensure that you are able to most effectively participate in the comment thread.
In order to maintain a healthy community, moderators reserve the right to remove any content and any user account for any reason at any time. See: Community Guidelines

topic_details.topic_title: Decades of Disaster: Biden Is Right to End the War in Afghanistan

posts.post_description: Originally published at: Decades of Disaster: Biden Is Right to End the War in Afghanistan

Peter Certo quotes something Biden said which has been troubling me:
“If Afghanistan is unable to mount any real resistance to the Taliban now,” Biden said, “there is no chance that one more year, five more years, or 20 more years of U.S. military boots on the ground would have made any difference.”
That, in various forms, has been repeated over and over: Those consarn lazy-ass Afghans, if they’re not willing to fight for their own country, why should we? Does this messaging sound the slightest bit contemptuous, possibly racist-slash-Islamophobic, to anyone else?
It should be perfectly clear to all by now: Afghans don’t resist Taliban because they regard Taliban as Afghan. Couldn’t be much simpler. Why twist it into this distorted picture of Afghan weakness, corruption, or incompetence? Doesn’t such an attitude risk piling on with more recklessly scattershot contempt for a proud people?

Peter Certo wrote: " When the president took off with a helicopter full of cash, many Afghan soldiers sensibly concluded it wasn’t worth dying for any longer.”
I doubt that the collapse started so late. Biden fails to have empathy with the Afghan soldier. As Master Sun’s Art of War points out, integrity of a nation at war depends on the leader convincing everybody of a powerful mission statement. Soldiers must believe in their mission, and belief and trust must be both solid and flexible up and down the line of command. If I believe that my squad leader works for my benefit and our common cause, that belief has to entail a belief that at all points in the line of command there are people who are behind me and behind every soldier.
I think the reality, as the average Afghan soldier saw it, was that the real line of “having my back,” went through Americans they had direct contact with. What was left for this soldier if the USA pulled out?
My belief is that a nation and/or an army cannot successfully be imposed from outside. It must develop organically, from within the people. How did George Washington manage to get a real army out of former colonials, most of whom probably only knew what they didn’t want. What made an apprentice miller boy into a soldier and kept him in that role?
Certo has it right.

While we of course should be leaving Afghanistan (shouldn’t have been there in first place) it is plainly obvious that we could not have done it in a more haphazard way. Jeebus on a cracker! Who is running things at the State dept and Pentagon these days, the Marx brothers? “Sorry everybody, but after 20 years you have 5 minutes to pack your bags and get to the airport. Where are we taking you? We’ll figure that out once we get in the air….”
While there was probably no good way to exit Afghanistan after all this time, we didn’t need to turn it in to a crappy community theater version of the fall of Saigon.
And now, matters are worse. Another wave of Covid is hitting the US. The economy is still sluggish. Gerrymandering has begun in earnest in key battleground states, and now old uncle Joe Biden and his equally feeble acolytes have decided that what the Democratic Party really needed at this time of crisis is another Bay of Pigs fiasco.
Onward to 2022……

topic_details.topic_title: Adding to US Failures in Afghanistan, Taliban Have Grabbed Billions in Weaponry

posts.post_description: Originally published at: Adding to US Failures in Afghanistan, Taliban Have Grabbed Billions in Weaponry
I shouldn’t post at moments like this, but it’s possible some readers of the Commons have been wondering if it’s even possible: I’m at a loss for words, struck dumb!

Taliban have cut off trade with India. Another point that Pakistan army officers are leading the taliban strategy and tactics. No one can control the young taliban goon out on the street tormenting all others.
The saddest story of leaving behind the afghan peoples who assisted us out in the countryside cannot be fixed. We have no way to help them travel past check points and avoid capture and death. Taliban are now and will revenge.
accurate news = Reuters dot com

Well now the USA will have to purchase a whole new set of weaponry to replace the ones they left behind. The military merchandise merry-go-round goes round and round and round… I can just picture the war profiteers in their board rooms laughing and slapping each other’s backs.
I know some people think everybody should have a gun, but this is going too far.

topic_details.topic_title: US Urged to Aid Afghan Journalists Seeking Safe Passage Amid Reports of Taliban Beatings

posts.post_description: Originally published at: US Urged to Aid Afghan Journalists Seeking Safe Passage Amid Reports of Taliban Beatings

This story is about 300 journalists.
The story should be that USA is too darn slow with flights out of Afghan.
10,000 to 15,000 Americans who previously were told to leave and arrogantly did not.
Trainers, mercenaries, merchants galore. Now, we have DC telling us that it is our moral obligation to save each one. Three generations ago, those reluctants would not have sympathy.
Gen’l Miley at today’s 3pm eastern explanation only lied twice. Which is normal by dod.
Ramp up evacuation daily counts?
For heavens sake, in four or five days we cannot flex our Air Force transport schedules to work this evacuation? Waiting for contract air carriers!!!
Left unsaid, how do we reach out and protect the translators and their families from taliban deadly retribution’s. These folks are all over afghan.
How do we fly them out.
Last: how do we punish Pakistan for their supporting the taliban all these years. ???

“reporter and photographer covering an anti-Taliban [protest] in Jalalabad were beaten by Taliban fighters, who opened fire on demonstrators, reportedly killing three people.”
Should Read:
reporter and photographer covering an anti-Trump [protest] in Portland were beaten by Portland PD, who opened fire on demonstrators, reportedly killing three people.

There are many similarities between the Afghan Taliban and America’s Christian Taliban, including:
They both hate journalists
They both seek to subjugate women.
They both believe in the same invisible sky daddy (albeit with different names for the deity).
They both are gun nuts.
They both favor violent authoritarianism.
They both favor violent overthrow of government.
They both are are anti-science and primitive.
They both are uneducated and patriarchal.
They both lie constantly.
They both seek theocracy.
They both use social media propaganda.
They both are anti-vaccine.
If you hate and fear the Afghan Taliban, you should feel the same towards the American version.

Name one thing good about America.
Charlie Parker. Ok. Who else? Ok, maybe Tom Waits.
West of the Rockies will be a desert in 15 years. Both the air and the ocean are full of plastic. The peyote might all get eaten. Then what?

THERE WILL BE JOY IN MAILVILLE------
for the disgusting, lying, cheating UNAmerican creep

How it can be that Biden can’t fire him and all his conspirators is beyond me, but he needs to be behind bars in a supermax.

Remove this jackass asap.

category.category_description: Discussion about this site, its organization, how it works, and how we can improve it.

posts.post_description:
Thanks for joining our community at The Commons, and welcome!
Here are a few quick tips to get you started and to help you along the way:
This private message has a few quick tips to get you started.
Keep scrolling
There are no next page buttons or page numbers – to read more, just keep scrolling down!
As new comments come in, they will appear automatically.
Where am I?
For search, your user page, or the menu, use the icon
☰
buttons at the upper right.
Any article title will take you to the next unread comment. Use the last activity time and comment count to enter at the top or bottom.
While reading a comments on an article, jump to the top ↑ by selecting the article title. Select the green progress bar at the bottom right for full navigation controls, or use the
home
and
end
keys.
How do I reply?
To reply to the overall article, use the Reply button at the very bottom of the page.
To reply to a specific comment, use the Reply button on that comment.
To quote someone in your reply, select the text you wish to quote, then press any Reply button.
To ping someone in your reply, mention their name. Type @ and an autocompleter will pop up.
For standard Emoji 7, just start typing : or the traditional smileys :)
What else can I do?
There are action buttons at the bottom of each comment.
To let someone know that you enjoyed their comment, use the like button. If you see a problem with a comment, please let our staff know about it by using the flag button or, if you wish, privately message the commenter with your concerns.
You can also share a link to a comment or bookmark it for later reference - it will be saved on your personal user page.
##Can I see my commenting history?##
Yes, your comments, along with likes and replies, are stored on your personal profile page. Live notifications will let you know whenever someone has replied or interacted with your comment.
##The comments aren’t threaded. How can I tell if someone has replied to my comment? Or if a comment is a response to something else?##
You can see all the replies to comments by clicking “replies”, as you can see here:
Who is talking to me?
When someone replies to your comment, quotes your comment, or mentions your @username, a number will immediately appear at the top right of your page. Use it access your notifications.
Don’t worry about missing a reply – you’ll be emailed direct replies (and private messages) if you aren’t online when they arrive.
When are conversations new?
By default all conversations less than two days old are considered new, and any conversation you’ve participated in (replied to, created, or read for an extended period) will automatically be tracked.
You will see the blue new and number indicators next to these articles:
You can change the individual notification state of an article’s discussion via the control at the bottom of the article discussion (this can also be set per category). To change how you track articles, or the definition of new, see your user preferences.
Why can’t I do certain things?
New users are somewhat limited for safety reasons as we build our new community. For example, most spammers and fly-by trolls post links or images then move on. Thus, new users cannot post links or images at first.
As you participate here - by reading, liking, sharing, and commenting, you’ll gain the trust of the community, and become a full citizen, and those limitations will automatically be removed. At a high enough trust level, you’ll gain even more abilities to help us manage our community together.
We believe in civilized community behavior at all times.
Enjoy your stay!

Can’t We All Get Along?
This is a Civilized Place for Public Discussion
Please treat this discussion forum with the same respect you would a public park. We, too, are a shared community resource — a place to share skills, knowledge and interests through ongoing conversation. These are not hard and fast rules, merely aids to the human judgment of our community. Use these guidelines to keep this a clean, well-lighted place for civilized public discourse.
Improve the Discussion
Help us make this a great place for discussion by always working to improve the discussion in some way, however small. If you are not sure your post adds to the conversation, think over what you want to say and try again later. The topics discussed here matter to us, and we want you to act as if they matter to you, too. Be respectful of the topics and the people discussing them, even if you disagree with some of what is being said.
Be Agreeable, Even When You Disagree
You may wish to respond to something by disagreeing with it. That’s fine. But, remember to criticize ideas, not people. Please avoid: Name-calling. Ad hominem attacks. Responding to a post’s tone instead of its actual content. Knee-jerk contradiction. Instead, provide reasoned counter-arguments that improve the conversation.
Be Nice to Our Writers, Even When They Piss You Off
Our contributing writers put their ideas and opinions into the public sphere using their real identities - not anonymous screen names. You may agree or disagree strongly with their ideas and we are providing you a forum to debate them. But any posters making personal attacks on our contributing writers will not be welcome in our community.
One Person, One Voice
All are welcome in our community. We believe that communities where people take a stand by speaking out using their real names are the healthiest communities. We understand that some need to remain anonymous for professional or personal reasons and we will allow for that. However, anyone attempting to use multiple screen names or log-ins is not welcome here. One person, one voice.
Your Participation Counts
The conversations we have here set the tone for everyone. Help us influence the future of this community by choosing to engage in discussions that make this forum an interesting place to be — and avoiding those that do not. The Commons provides tools that enable the community to collectively identify the best (and worst) contributions: favorites, bookmarks, likes, flags, replies, edits, and so forth. Use these tools to improve your own experience, and everyone else’s, too. Let’s try to leave our park better than we found it.
If You See a Problem, Flag It
Moderators have special authority; they are responsible for keeping this forum civil. But so are you. With your help, moderators can be community facilitators, not just janitors or police. When you see bad behavior, don’t reply. It encourages the bad behavior by acknowledging it, consumes your energy, and wastes everyone’s time. Just flag it. If enough flags accrue, action will be taken, either automatically or by moderator intervention. In order to maintain our community, moderators reserve the right to remove any content and any user account for any reason at any time. Moderators do not preview new posts in any way; the moderators and site operators take no responsibility for any content posted by the community.
Always Be Civil
Nothing sabotages a healthy conversation like rudeness: Be civil. Don’t post anything that a reasonable person would consider offensive, abusive, or hate speech. Keep it clean. Don’t post anything obscene or sexually explicit. Respect each other. Don’t harass or grief anyone, impersonate people, or expose their private information. Respect our forum. Don’t post spam or otherwise vandalize the forum. These are not concrete terms with precise definitions — avoid even the appearance of any of these things. If you’re unsure, ask yourself how you would feel if your post was featured on the front page of the New York Times. This is a public forum, and search engines index these discussions. Keep the language, links, and images safe for family and friends.
Keep It Tidy
Make the effort to put things in the right place, so that we can spend more time discussing and less cleaning up. So: Don’t cross-post the same thing in multiple topics. Don’t post no-content replies. Don’t divert a discussion by changing it midstream. Don’t sign your posts — every post has your profile information attached to it. Rather than posting “+1” or “Agreed”, use the Like button.
Post Only Your Own Stuff
You may not post anything digital that belongs to someone else without permission. You may not post descriptions of, links to, or methods for stealing someone’s intellectual property (software, video, audio, images), or for breaking any other law.
